infos.name: Zahlungszuschläge - Konfigurieren Sie Zuschläge und stupsen Sie Ihre Kunden an
infos.description:
Mit dem Plugin für Zahlungszuschläge können Sie dem Kunden die Verwendung einer bestimmten Zahlungsmethode in Rechnung stellen. Dies kann nur ein paar Cent sein, die den Kunden zu einer bevorzugten Methode bewegen.


Zuschläge können auf Zahlungsmethodenebene zum Preis Ihrer Wahl konfiguriert werden.


Sobald eine Zahlungsmethode ausgewählt wurde, wird der Bestellung, die den Zuschlag enthält, eine Werbebuchung hinzugefügt, und in der Bestellübersicht wird eine zusätzliche Angabe bereitgestellt.


Dies bietet eine optimale Skalierbarkeit und macht es sehr einfach, Ihre Zuschläge in Ihrem Auftragsverwaltungsprozess anzuzeigen.


Es ermöglicht auch die einfache Offenlegung dieser Daten über die native Shopware-API mit minimalem Platzbedarf in der Codebasis.
infos.installationManual:
• Laden Sie das Zeo Payment Surcharge-Plugin aus dem Community Store herunter
  • Aktivieren Sie das Plugin in Ihrer Shopware 6-Installation - dies kann über Einstellungen> System> Lizenzen erfolgen. Alternativ können Sie die Schaltfläche "Plugin hochladen" verwenden, um die ZIP-Datei des Plugins hochzuladen.
  • Öffnen Sie abschließend die Plugin-Konfiguration über Meine Plugins und die drei Punkte nach dem Plugin "Zahlungszuschlag-Konvertierung".
  • Stellen Sie sicher, dass der "aktive" Schalter aktiviert ist.
  • Speichern Sie die Konfiguration und gehen Sie zu Einstellungen> Shop> Zahlung.
  • Öffnen Sie die Details einer Zahlungsmethode Ihrer Wahl und suchen Sie die Zuschlagseinstellungen. Geben Sie unter Betrag den Betrag ein, der für die Verwendung dieser Zahlungsmethode berechnet werden soll.
infos.shortDescription: Mit dem Plugin für Zahlungszuschläge können Sie dem Kunden die Verwendung einer bestimmten Zahlungsmethode in Rechnung stellen. Schieben Sie Ihre Kunden zu Ihrer bevorzugten Methode.

infos.name: Payment Surcharges - Configure surcharges to favor certain payment methods
infos.description:
The payment surcharges plugin allows you to charge the customer for using a specific payment method. This can be just a couple of cents nudges the customer to a preferred method.


Surcharges are configurable on payment method level to the price of your choice.

Once a payment method is selected a line item will be added to the order containing the surcharge and an extra indication will be provided in the order summary.


This provided optimal scalability and makes it very easy to view your surcharges in your order management process.

It also allows for easy exposure of this data via the native Shopware API with a minimal footprint in the codebase.
infos.installationManual:
• Download the Zeo Payment Surcharge plugin from the Community Store 
  • Activate the plugin in your Shopware 6 installation – this can be done via Settings > System > Licenses. Alternatively, you can use the "Upload plugin" button to upload the plugin ZIP file. 
  • Finally, open the plugin configuration via My Plugins and the three dots after the "Payment Surcharge Conversion" plugin. 
  • Be sure to have the "active" toggle enabled. 
  • Save the configuration and head over to Settings > Shop > Payment. 
  • Open the details of a payment method of your choice and find Surcharge Settings. Under Amount, fill in the amount that should be charged for using this payment method.

comments.text:
Initially I had big problems to get the module to work. Partly, the names in the manual no longer correspond to those in Shopware 6. So I did not know if I had really installed everything correctly. However, my problem was in a different place. I forgot to deactivate the cache before the installation, which is why I always got the old environment displayed. Now everything works and I could just test the module. 

First what I like:

- On the contrary to another module provider, I find it clearer that the surcharges are displayed directly with the shipping costs. 
- You don't have to create rules first to enter surcharges. The entry of surcharges is solved very simply.

- What I do not like so much:

-The surcharge is declared as an amount in the respective payment method. The customer therefore does not know how many percentages are actually charged. I would find it better if this was declared as follows: PayPal | 3.4% surcharge

- When summarizing the fees, the surcharge is simply declared as «payment costs». Here it would be nice if the surcharge could be declared more precisely. Example: 3.4% PayPal commission
Since everyone has their own idea of designations, it would be handy to be able to name the expense individually in the payment types.

- I would like to charge an extra fee for orders under €50. But currently there is only the possibility to charge a fee on payment types.

- This module costs more than twice as much as the module from Arcris, which brings the same functions. In addition, I can also charge a minimum quantity surcharge, which is unfortunately not possible here.  However, I find the declaration of the surcharges in the shipping costs here better solved than in Arcris, which output the additional costs as products.
comments.headline: Good but still room for improvement

comments.text: The plugin does all we need, checkout and  account recalculates well
comments.headline: Good functionality and great support

changelog.text: Resolved class used in media and CartPersister.
Made type nullable to avoid error in certain instances.
-   Added configurable order limit for surcharge. The surcharge will be removed once a certain order limit gets reached.
- Resolved issue which caused unavailable items in cart to be removed on cart recalculation during the order edit process.
- Improved order recalculation after payment method switch.
- Fixed issue in checkout where a null issue would occur in some occasions.

- Added option to change the type of the surcharge amount from absolute to percentage. 

- Added dutch snippets for the administration.

- Added better translations for storefront.

- Added support for changing the payment method after placing the order. The surcharge is now added or removed correctly.
- Storefront presentation of surcharge improved in order summary and off canvas cart.

- Added prevention method of negative surcharges 

- Fixed bug where error would occur after resetting the surcharge of a payment method
- Fixed double payment surcharge on order edit

# 1.0.0 

- First version of the Zeo S6 Payment Surcharge plugin for Shopware 6
